title: Science (PCM)
description: For students interested in Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, and Technology.

roadmap.details: Focus on Physics, Chemistry, and Maths core concepts. Start preparing for entrance exams (JEE/SAT).
Master calculus and mechanics. Score high in Board exams. Finalize college applications.
Introduction to Programming, Data Structures, and Core Engineering subjects. Explore internships.
Choose electives (AI/ML, Robotics, Civil). Work on capstone projects. Secure pre-placement offers.
Start as a Junior Engineer, Data Analyst, or Researcher. Focus on upskilling and networking.

title: Science (PCB)
description: For students interested in Medicine, Biology, Biotechnology, and Healthcare.

roadmap.details: In-depth study of Biology (Botany & Zoology), Chemistry, and Physics. Begin NEET/Pre-Med prep.
Focus on competitive exams. Balance Board exam preparation. Explore Allied Health options.
Intensive laboratry work. Understanding human body systems. Community medicine introductory.
Hands-on experience in hospitals. Rotating through Surgery, Pediatrics, Internal Medicine.
Choosing a specialty (Cardiology, Neurology). Intensive practical training and research.

title: Commerce
description: For students interested in Finance, Business, Economics, and Management.

roadmap.details: Basics of Accounting, Economics, and Business Studies. improving command over numbers.
Advanced Accounting and Macroeconomics. Preparation for CA/CS/B.Com entrance exams.
B.Com/BBA. Basics of Marketing, HR, and Finance. internships in startups or firms.
Appearing for CA Inter / CFA Level 1 / MBA Entrance (CAT/GMAT). Specializing in Finance.
Financial Analyst, Auditor, or Marketing Associate. Pursuit of MBA.

title: Arts & Humanities
description: For students interested in Literature, Psychology, History, Design, and Civil Services.

roadmap.details: Exploring History, Psychology, Sociology, and Political Science. Developing writing skills.
Deep dive into chosen electives. Board exams. Preparation for Design/Law/Liberal Arts entrance.
Foundation courses in Liberal Arts or Design. Exploring various disciplines. Volunteering.
Dissertation work. Building a strong design portfolio or publishing papers. Internships in NGOs/Media.
Masters degree in specialized field or joining Journalism, Public Policy, or Creative Industry.
